Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses feelings of depression and being overwhelmed, particularly due to concerns about her daughter and feeling stuck in her own life.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has experienced moments of happiness while spending time with her granddaughter, but also struggles with sleep and feelings of overwhelm. Communication with her daughter has improved, leading to a stronger connection.
Psychosocial History: The patient has made efforts to connect with her granddaughter and has recently communicated her feelings to her daughter, which has been a positive experience.
Current Functional Status: The patient has been engaging in self-care activities such as watching movies and practicing mindfulness, which have positively impacted her mood.
Progress Evaluation: The patient has shown progress in practicing mindfulness and has committed to incorporating stretching into her routine.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to try stretching and to connect with friends as coping mechanisms.
Next Steps: The patient plans to practice mindfulness, incorporate stretching, spend time with her granddaughter, and reach out to a friend for support.
